summary: This document is an Office of the Inspector General memo regarding evidence retrieved from the FBI for OIG Case 2019-010614. It details the chain of custody for two log books seized from the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) in 2019, noting the original custody document is missing.

persons.name: Special Agent
persons.context: The OIG Special Agent who retrieved evidence from an FBI SA and turned it over to the NYFO Evidence Custodian.

persons.name: FBI SA
persons.context: The FBI Special Agent from whom evidence was retrieved by the OIG SA.

persons.name: SA McGinnis
persons.context: The evidence was transferred to this agent as part of a related OIG case (2019-011073).

connections.description: The OIG SA retrieved evidence from the FBI SA as part of an evidence transfer.
Evidence was transferred to SA McGinnis as part of a related OIG investigation.

events.title: Seizure of Log Books from MCC
events.description: Property, including a green Law Enforcement/BOP Staff log book and a green social visiting log book, was seized from the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC).

events.title: Evidence Retrieved from FBI
events.description: An OIG Special Agent retrieved the seized log book evidence from an FBI SA and turned it over to the NYFO Evidence Custodian.

keyFacts: Two log books (a Law Enforcement/BOP Staff log and a social visiting log) were seized from the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) on August 21, 2019.
The original Evidence Custody Document (ECD) for this seizure (Log #6) cannot be located, creating a gap in the documented chain of custody.
The evidence was part of OIG Case 2019-010614 and was later transferred as part of a related case, OIG Case 2019-011073.
The memo from November 18, 2021, documents the retrieval of this evidence from the FBI and its placement into the NYFO evidence room.
